graphSupervisor.graph module¶

graphSupervisor.schema module¶

Module defining data models for research teams and their members using Pydantic.

This module provides structured representations for: - Persons involved in research teams. - Research teams with their specific roles and responsibilities. - Perspectives containing multiple research teams.

Classes:

  • Person: Represents an individual in a research team with detailed attributes.

  • ResearchTeam: Represents a team consisting of an analyst and a reviewer.

  • Perspectives: Represents a collection of research teams.

Attributes in each class are well-defined using Pydantic’s Field for validation and metadata.

class graphSupervisor.schema.Person(*, name: str, role: str, description: str)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represent an individual in a research team with attributes defining their role and focus.

name¶

The name of the person.

Type:

str

role¶

The role of the person within the team (e.g., Analyst or Reviewer).

Type:

str

description¶

A detailed description of the person’s key competencies, tasks, concerns, and motives.

Type:

str

Properties:

persona (str): A formatted string summarizing the person’s details.

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

Provide a formatted representation of the person’s details.

Returns:

A string containing the name, role, and description of the person.

str

class graphSupervisor.schema.ResearchTeam(*, name: str, description: str, analyst: Person, reviewer: Person)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represent a research team with a specific focus and roles for its members.

name¶

The name of the team (must use predefined names).

Type:

str

description¶

A brief description of the team’s purpose and responsibilities.

Type:

str

analyst¶

Information about the analyst in the team.

Type:

Person

reviewer¶

Information about the reviewer in the team.

Type:

Person

Properties:

team (str): A formatted string summarizing the team’s details, including the analyst and reviewer personas.

property team: str¶

Provide a detailed representation of the research team’s structure and members.
